title.raw: 卷一下 高帝紀下 Volume 1: Annals of Emperor Gaozu 2

sentences.zh: 五年冬十月，漢王追項羽至陽夏南止軍，與齊王信、魏相國越期會擊楚，至固陵，不會。

translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month of winter in the fifth year, King Han pursued Xiang Yu and halted his army south of Yangxia. He had made an appointment with King Qi Xin and Wei prime minister Yue to join forces and attack Chu, but they did not arrive at Gulong.
translations.text: In the tenth month of winter in the fifth year, King Han pursued Xiang Yu and halted his army south of Yangxia. He had made an appointment with King Qi Xin and Wei prime minister Yue to join forces and attack Chu, but they did not arrive at Gulong.

sentences.zh: 楚擊漢軍，大破 之。

translations.idiomatic: Chu attacked the Han army and greatly defeated it.
translations.text: Chu attacked the Han army and greatly defeated it.

sentences.zh: 漢王復入壁，深塹而守。

translations.idiomatic: King Han retreated back into his fortifications, dug deep moats, and defended.
translations.text: King Han retreated back into his fortifications, dug deep moats, and defended.

sentences.zh: 謂張良曰：「諸侯不從，柰何？」

translations.idiomatic: He said to Zhang Liang: "The feudal lords are not following. What should we do?"
translations.text: He said to Zhang Liang: "The feudal lords are not following. What should we do?"

sentences.zh: 良對曰：「楚兵且破，未有分地，其不至固宜。

translations.idiomatic: Liang replied: "The Chu army is about to be broken, but they have not yet divided the land. Their failure to come is natural.
translations.text: Liang replied: "The Chu army is about to be broken, but they have not yet divided the land. Their failure to come is natural.

sentences.zh: 君王能與共天下，可立致也。

translations.idiomatic: If your majesty can share the world with them, they can be made to come immediately."
translations.text: If your majesty can share the world with them, they can be made to come immediately."

sentences.zh: 齊王信之立，非君王 意，信亦不自堅。

translations.idiomatic: King Qi Xin's establishment was not your majesty's intention, and Xin himself is not firm.
translations.text: King Qi Xin's establishment was not your majesty's intention, and Xin himself is not firm.

sentences.zh: 彭越本定梁地，始君王以魏豹故，拜越為相國。

translations.idiomatic: Peng Yue originally pacified Liang territory. At first your majesty, because of Wei Bao, appointed Yue as prime minister.
translations.text: Peng Yue originally pacified Liang territory. At first your majesty, because of Wei Bao, appointed Yue as prime minister.

sentences.zh: 今豹死，越亦望王，而君王不早定。

translations.idiomatic: Now Bao is dead, and Yue also hopes to become king, but your majesty has not decided early.
translations.text: Now Bao is dead, and Yue also hopes to become king, but your majesty has not decided early.

sentences.zh: 今能取睢陽以北至穀城皆以王彭越，從陳以東傅海與齊王信， 信家在楚，其意欲復得故邑。

translations.idiomatic: Now if you can take Suiyang north to Gucheng and all give it to enfeoff Peng Yue as king, and from Chen east to the sea and give it to King Qi Xin, Xin's family is in Chu, and his intention is to regain his former territory.
translations.text: Now if you can take Suiyang north to Gucheng and all give it to enfeoff Peng Yue as king, and from Chen east to the sea and give it to King Qi Xin, Xin's family is in Chu, and his intention is to regain his former territory.

sentences.zh: 能出捐此地以許兩人，使各自為戰，則楚易敗也。」

translations.idiomatic: If you can give up this land to satisfy these two men, letting each fight for himself, then Chu will be easy to defeat."
translations.text: If you can give up this land to satisfy these two men, letting each fight for himself, then Chu will be easy to defeat."

sentences.zh: 於是漢王發使使韓信、彭越。

translations.idiomatic: So King Han sent envoys to Han Xin and Peng Yue.
translations.text: So King Han sent envoys to Han Xin and Peng Yue.

sentences.zh: 至，皆引兵來。

translations.idiomatic: They arrived and both led troops to come.
translations.text: They arrived and both led troops to come.

sentences.zh: 十一月，劉賈入楚地，圍壽春。

translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh month, Liu Jia entered Chu territory and surrounded Shouchun.
translations.text: In the eleventh month, Liu Jia entered Chu territory and surrounded Shouchun.

sentences.zh: 漢亦遣人誘楚大司馬周殷。

translations.idiomatic: Han also sent people to entice Chu grand marshal Zhou Yin.
translations.text: Han also sent people to entice Chu grand marshal Zhou Yin.

sentences.zh: 殷畔楚，以舒屠六，舉九江兵迎黥布，並行屠城父，隨劉賈皆會。

translations.idiomatic: Yin rebelled against Chu, massacred Liuchu with Ying Bu, raised the Jiujiang troops to welcome Ying Bu, and together marched to massacre Chengfu, following Liu Jia to all assemble.
translations.text: Yin rebelled against Chu, massacred Liuchu with Ying Bu, raised the Jiujiang troops to welcome Ying Bu, and together marched to massacre Chengfu, following Liu Jia to all assemble.

sentences.zh: 十二月，圍羽垓下。

translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month, they surrounded Xiang Yu at Gaixia.
translations.text: In the twelfth month, they surrounded Xiang Yu at Gaixia.

sentences.zh: 羽夜聞漢軍四面皆楚歌，知盡得楚地，羽與數百騎走，是以兵大敗。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu at night heard that Han troops on all four sides were singing Chu songs, knew they had taken all Chu territory, and Xiang Yu fled with several hundred cavalry, which is why his army suffered a great defeat.
translations.text: Xiang Yu at night heard that Han troops on all four sides were singing Chu songs, knew they had taken all Chu territory, and Xiang Yu fled with several hundred cavalry, which is why his army suffered a great defeat.

sentences.zh: 灌嬰追斬羽東 城。

translations.idiomatic: Guan Ying pursued and beheaded Xiang Yu at Dongcheng.
translations.text: Guan Ying pursued and beheaded Xiang Yu at Dongcheng.

sentences.zh: 楚地悉定，獨魯不下。

translations.idiomatic: Chu territory was completely pacified, only Lu did not submit.
translations.text: Chu territory was completely pacified, only Lu did not submit.

sentences.zh: 漢王引天下兵欲屠之，為其守節禮義之國，乃持羽頭示其父兄，魯乃降。

translations.idiomatic: King Han led the troops of the world wanting to massacre them, but since it was a state that upheld propriety and righteousness, he held Xiang Yu's head to show their fathers and brothers. Lu then surrendered.
translations.text: King Han led the troops of the world wanting to massacre them, but since it was a state that upheld propriety and righteousness, he held Xiang Yu's head to show their fathers and brothers. Lu then surrendered.

sentences.zh: 初，懷王封羽為魯公，及死，魯又為之堅守，故以魯公葬羽於穀 城。

translations.idiomatic: Initially, King Huai had enfeoffed Xiang Yu as Lord of Lu, and after his death, Lu again defended firmly for him. Therefore they buried Xiang Yu as Lord of Lu at Gucheng.
translations.text: Initially, King Huai had enfeoffed Xiang Yu as Lord of Lu, and after his death, Lu again defended firmly for him. Therefore they buried Xiang Yu as Lord of Lu at Gucheng.

sentences.zh: 漢王為發葬，哭臨而去。

translations.idiomatic: King Han conducted the funeral rites and wept at the grave before leaving.
translations.text: King Han conducted the funeral rites and wept at the grave before leaving.

sentences.zh: 封項伯等四人為列侯，賜姓劉氏。

translations.idiomatic: He enfeoffed Xiang Bo and three others as marquises and granted them the surname Liu.
translations.text: He enfeoffed Xiang Bo and three others as marquises and granted them the surname Liu.

sentences.zh: 諸民略在楚者皆歸之。

translations.idiomatic: All the people who had been seized in Chu were returned.
translations.text: All the people who had been seized in Chu were returned.

sentences.zh: 漢王還至定陶，馳入齊王信壁，奪其軍。

translations.idiomatic: King Han returned to Dingtao and galloped into King Qi Xin's encampment, seizing his army.
translations.text: King Han returned to Dingtao and galloped into King Qi Xin's encampment, seizing his army.

sentences.zh: 初項羽所立臨江王共敖前死，子尉嗣 立為王，不降。

translations.idiomatic: Initially, the Linjiang King Gong Ao whom Xiang Yu had established had died earlier. His son Wei succeeded as king and did not surrender.
translations.text: Initially, the Linjiang King Gong Ao whom Xiang Yu had established had died earlier. His son Wei succeeded as king and did not surrender.

sentences.zh: 遣盧綰、劉賈擊虜尉。

translations.idiomatic: He sent Lu Wan and Liu Jia to attack and capture Wei.
translations.text: He sent Lu Wan and Liu Jia to attack and capture Wei.

sentences.zh: 春正月，追尊兄伯號曰武哀侯。

translations.idiomatic: In the first month of spring, he posthumously honored his elder brother with the title Lord Wu'ai.
translations.text: In the first month of spring, he posthumously honored his elder brother with the title Lord Wu'ai.

sentences.zh: 下令曰：「楚地已定，義帝亡後，欲存恤楚眾，以定其主。

translations.idiomatic: He issued an order: "Chu territory is already pacified. After the Righteous Emperor's death, I wish to care for the Chu multitudes and establish their ruler.
translations.text: He issued an order: "Chu territory is already pacified. After the Righteous Emperor's death, I wish to care for the Chu multitudes and establish their ruler.

sentences.zh: 齊王信習楚風 俗，更立為楚王，王淮北，都下邳。

translations.idiomatic: King Qi Xin was accustomed to Chu customs, so he re-established him as King of Chu, ruling north of the Huai, capital at Xiapi."
translations.text: King Qi Xin was accustomed to Chu customs, so he re-established him as King of Chu, ruling north of the Huai, capital at Xiapi."

sentences.zh: 魏相國建城侯彭越勤勞魏民，卑下士卒，常以少擊眾，數破楚軍，其以魏故地王之，號曰梁王，都定陶。」

translations.idiomatic: Wei prime minister Lord Jiancheng Peng Yue worked hard for the Wei people, treated officers and soldiers humbly, often attacked many with few, repeatedly broke Chu armies. For this he was enfeoffed with the former Wei territory as king, titled King of Liang, capital at Dingtao."
translations.text: Wei prime minister Lord Jiancheng Peng Yue worked hard for the Wei people, treated officers and soldiers humbly, often attacked many with few, repeatedly broke Chu armies. For this he was enfeoffed with the former Wei territory as king, titled King of Liang, capital at Dingtao."

sentences.zh: 又曰：「兵不得休八 年，萬民與苦甚，今天下事畢，其赦天下殊死以下。」

translations.idiomatic: He also said: "The troops have not rested for eight years. The ten thousand people have suffered greatly. Now the world's affairs are finished. Pardon all those sentenced to death or below."
translations.text: He also said: "The troops have not rested for eight years. The ten thousand people have suffered greatly. Now the world's affairs are finished. Pardon all those sentenced to death or below."

sentences.zh: 於是諸侯上疏曰：「楚王韓信、韓王信、淮南王英布、梁王彭越、故衡山王吳芮、趙王張敖、燕王臧荼昧 死再拜言，大王陛下：先時秦為亡道，天下誅之。

translations.idiomatic: So the feudal lords submitted a memorial: "King of Chu Han Xin, King of Han Xin, King of Huainan Ying Bu, King of Liang Peng Yue, former King of Hengshan Wu Rui, King of Zhao Zhang Ao, King of Yan Zang Tu, risking death, bow twice and say: Great King Your Majesty, previously Qin acted without righteousness, the world executed it.
translations.text: So the feudal lords submitted a memorial: "King of Chu Han Xin, King of Han Xin, King of Huainan Ying Bu, King of Liang Peng Yue, former King of Hengshan Wu Rui, King of Zhao Zhang Ao, King of Yan Zang Tu, risking death, bow twice and say: Great King Your Majesty, previously Qin acted without righteousness, the world executed it.

sentences.zh: 大王先得秦王，定關中，於天下功最多。

translations.idiomatic: Your Majesty first obtained the Qin king and pacified Guanzhong. Your merit for the world is the greatest.
translations.text: Your Majesty first obtained the Qin king and pacified Guanzhong. Your merit for the world is the greatest.

sentences.zh: 存亡定危，救敗繼絕，以安萬民，功盛德厚。

translations.idiomatic: You preserved the perishing and stabilized the endangered, rescued the defeated and continued the extinct, to pacify the ten thousand people. Your merit is abundant and your virtue is thick.
translations.text: You preserved the perishing and stabilized the endangered, rescued the defeated and continued the extinct, to pacify the ten thousand people. Your merit is abundant and your virtue is thick.

sentences.zh: 又加惠於諸侯王有功者，使 得立社稷。

translations.idiomatic: You have also bestowed favor on the feudal lords and kings who have merit, enabling them to establish their ancestral temples.
translations.text: You have also bestowed favor on the feudal lords and kings who have merit, enabling them to establish their ancestral temples.

sentences.zh: 地分已定，而位號比儗，亡上下之分，大王功德之著，於後世不宣。

translations.idiomatic: The territories have been divided and established, but your position and title are equal to others, without distinction of superior and inferior. Your Majesty's merit and virtue are manifest, but for later generations it will not be proclaimed.
translations.text: The territories have been divided and established, but your position and title are equal to others, without distinction of superior and inferior. Your Majesty's merit and virtue are manifest, but for later generations it will not be proclaimed.

sentences.zh: 昧死再拜上皇帝尊號。」

translations.idiomatic: Risking death, we bow twice and present the title of Emperor."
translations.text: Risking death, we bow twice and present the title of Emperor."

sentences.zh: 漢王曰：「寡人聞帝者賢者有也，虛言亡實之名，非所取 也。

translations.idiomatic: King Han said: "I have heard that 'emperor' is for the worthy. An empty name without substance is not what I take.
translations.text: King Han said: "I have heard that 'emperor' is for the worthy. An empty name without substance is not what I take.

sentences.zh: 今諸侯王皆推高寡人，將何以處之哉？」

translations.idiomatic: Now all the feudal lords elevate me. How should I deal with this?"
translations.text: Now all the feudal lords elevate me. How should I deal with this?"

sentences.zh: 諸侯王皆曰：「大王起於細微，滅亂秦，威動海內。

translations.idiomatic: All the feudal lords said: "Your Majesty rose from humble origins, destroyed the chaotic Qin, and your might shook within the seas.
translations.text: All the feudal lords said: "Your Majesty rose from humble origins, destroyed the chaotic Qin, and your might shook within the seas.

sentences.zh: 又以辟陋之地，自漢中行威德，誅不義，立有功，平定海內，功臣 皆受地食邑，非私之也。

translations.idiomatic: You also from remote and narrow territory, from Hanzhong displayed awe-inspiring virtue, executed the unrighteous, established those with merit, pacified within the seas. The meritorious ministers all received land and fiefs. It was not private.
translations.text: You also from remote and narrow territory, from Hanzhong displayed awe-inspiring virtue, executed the unrighteous, established those with merit, pacified within the seas. The meritorious ministers all received land and fiefs. It was not private.

sentences.zh: 大王德施四海，諸侯王不足以道之，居帝位甚實宜，願大王以幸天下。」

translations.idiomatic: Your Majesty's virtue extends to the four seas. The feudal lords are insufficient to express it. Occupying the imperial position is very fitting indeed. We wish Your Majesty to favor the world."
translations.text: Your Majesty's virtue extends to the four seas. The feudal lords are insufficient to express it. Occupying the imperial position is very fitting indeed. We wish Your Majesty to favor the world."

sentences.zh: 漢王曰：「諸侯王幸以為便於天下之民，則可矣。」

translations.idiomatic: King Han said: "If the feudal lords consider it convenient for the world's people, then it is acceptable."
translations.text: King Han said: "If the feudal lords consider it convenient for the world's people, then it is acceptable."

sentences.zh: 於是諸侯王及 太尉長安侯臣綰等三百人，與博士稷嗣君叔孫通謹擇良日二月甲午，上尊號。

translations.idiomatic: So the feudal lords and Grand Marshal Lord Chang'an Chen Wan and 300 others, together with Erudite Ji, Successor Lord Shu Sun Tong, carefully chose an auspicious day, the jiawu day of the second month, and presented the honored title.
translations.text: So the feudal lords and Grand Marshal Lord Chang'an Chen Wan and 300 others, together with Erudite Ji, Successor Lord Shu Sun Tong, carefully chose an auspicious day, the jiawu day of the second month, and presented the honored title.

sentences.zh: 漢王即皇帝位于氾水之陽。

translations.idiomatic: King Han ascended the imperial throne at Fenshui's northern bank.
translations.text: King Han ascended the imperial throne at Fenshui's northern bank.

sentences.zh: 尊王后曰皇后，太子曰皇太子，追尊先媼曰昭靈夫人。

translations.idiomatic: He honored the queen as empress, the crown prince as imperial crown prince, and posthumously honored his late mother as Lady Zhaoling.
translations.text: He honored the queen as empress, the crown prince as imperial crown prince, and posthumously honored his late mother as Lady Zhaoling.

sentences.zh: 詔曰：「故衡山王吳芮與子二人、兄子一人，從百粵之兵，以佐諸侯，誅暴秦，有大功，諸侯立以為王。

translations.idiomatic: The edict said: "The former King of Hengshan Wu Rui, with two sons and one nephew, led Baiyue troops to assist the feudal lords, executed the violent Qin, had great merit. The feudal lords established him as king.
translations.text: The edict said: "The former King of Hengshan Wu Rui, with two sons and one nephew, led Baiyue troops to assist the feudal lords, executed the violent Qin, had great merit. The feudal lords established him as king.

sentences.zh: 項羽侵奪之地，謂之番君。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu invaded and seized his territory, calling him Fan Jun.
translations.text: Xiang Yu invaded and seized his territory, calling him Fan Jun.

sentences.zh: 其以長沙、豫章、象郡、桂林、南海立番君芮為長沙王。」

translations.idiomatic: Enfeoff Fan Jun Wu Rui as King of Changsha with Changsha, Yuzhang, Xiangjun, Guilin, and Nanhai."
translations.text: Enfeoff Fan Jun Wu Rui as King of Changsha with Changsha, Yuzhang, Xiangjun, Guilin, and Nanhai."

sentences.zh: 又曰：「故粵王亡諸世奉粵祀，秦侵奪其地，使其社稷不得血食。

translations.idiomatic: He also said: "The former Yue kings' descendants have maintained the Yue sacrifices. Qin invaded and seized their territory, causing their ancestral temples to lack blood offerings.
translations.text: He also said: "The former Yue kings' descendants have maintained the Yue sacrifices. Qin invaded and seized their territory, causing their ancestral temples to lack blood offerings.

sentences.zh: 諸侯伐秦， 亡諸身帥閩中兵以佐滅秦，項羽廢而弗立。

translations.idiomatic: The feudal lords attacked Qin. The descendants personally led Minzhong troops to assist in destroying Qin. Xiang Yu deposed them and did not establish them.
translations.text: The feudal lords attacked Qin. The descendants personally led Minzhong troops to assist in destroying Qin. Xiang Yu deposed them and did not establish them.

sentences.zh: 今以為閩粵王，王閩中地，勿使失職。」

translations.idiomatic: Now establish them as King of Minyue, ruling Minzhong territory, do not let them lose their office."
translations.text: Now establish them as King of Minyue, ruling Minzhong territory, do not let them lose their office."

sentences.zh: 帝乃西都洛陽。

translations.idiomatic: The emperor then established his western capital at Luoyang.
translations.text: The emperor then established his western capital at Luoyang.

sentences.zh: 夏五月，兵皆罷歸家。

translations.idiomatic: In the fifth month of summer, all troops were disbanded and sent home.
translations.text: In the fifth month of summer, all troops were disbanded and sent home.

sentences.zh: 詔曰：「諸侯子在關中者，復之十二歲，其歸者半之。

translations.idiomatic: The edict said: "Feudal lords' sons in Guanzhong are exempted from taxes for 12 years. Those who return are exempted for half that."
translations.text: The edict said: "Feudal lords' sons in Guanzhong are exempted from taxes for 12 years. Those who return are exempted for half that."

sentences.zh: 民前或相聚 保山澤，不書名數，今天下已定，令各歸其縣，復故爵田宅，吏以文法教訓辨告，勿笞辱。

translations.idiomatic: People who previously gathered in mountain marshes and did not register their names and numbers - now that the world is pacified, command them each to return to their counties, restore their former ranks, fields, and homes. Officials shall teach and instruct with civil laws, do not beat or humiliate.
translations.text: People who previously gathered in mountain marshes and did not register their names and numbers - now that the world is pacified, command them each to return to their counties, restore their former ranks, fields, and homes. Officials shall teach and instruct with civil laws, do not beat or humiliate.

sentences.zh: 民以飢餓自賣為人奴婢者，皆免為庶人。

translations.idiomatic: People who sold themselves as slaves or concubines due to starvation are all freed as commoners.
translations.text: People who sold themselves as slaves or concubines due to starvation are all freed as commoners.

sentences.zh: 軍吏卒會赦，其亡罪而亡爵及不 滿大夫者，皆賜爵為大夫。

translations.idiomatic: Military officers and soldiers who assembled for the amnesty - those without crime but without rank or below the rank of grand master are all granted the rank of grand master.
translations.text: Military officers and soldiers who assembled for the amnesty - those without crime but without rank or below the rank of grand master are all granted the rank of grand master.

sentences.zh: 故大夫以上賜爵各一級，其七大夫以上，皆令食邑，非七大夫以下，皆復其身及戶，勿事。」

translations.idiomatic: Former grand masters and above are granted one rank each. Those seventh rank grand master and above are all given fiefs. Those below seventh rank grand master are exempted from service for themselves and their households."
translations.text: Former grand masters and above are granted one rank each. Those seventh rank grand master and above are all given fiefs. Those below seventh rank grand master are exempted from service for themselves and their households."

sentences.zh: 又曰：「七大夫、公乘以上，皆高爵也。

translations.idiomatic: He also said: "Seventh rank grand master and public chariot driver and above are all high ranks.
translations.text: He also said: "Seventh rank grand master and public chariot driver and above are all high ranks.

sentences.zh: 諸 侯子及從軍歸者，甚多高爵，吾數詔吏先與田宅，及所當求於吏者，亟與。

translations.idiomatic: Feudal lords' sons and those returning from military service have many high ranks. I have repeatedly commanded officials to first give them fields and homes, and whatever they should seek from officials, give it quickly.
translations.text: Feudal lords' sons and those returning from military service have many high ranks. I have repeatedly commanded officials to first give them fields and homes, and whatever they should seek from officials, give it quickly.

sentences.zh: 爵或人君，上所尊禮，久立吏前，曾不為決，甚亡謂也。

translations.idiomatic: Ranks are from the ruler, honored by superiors. Standing long before officials, not deciding, is very improper.
translations.text: Ranks are from the ruler, honored by superiors. Standing long before officials, not deciding, is very improper.

sentences.zh: 異日秦民爵公大夫以上，令丞與 亢禮。

translations.idiomatic: In former days Qin people with ranks of public official and grand master and above, the county magistrate and assistant treated them with equal ceremony.
translations.text: In former days Qin people with ranks of public official and grand master and above, the county magistrate and assistant treated them with equal ceremony.

sentences.zh: 今吾於爵非輕也，吏獨安取此！

translations.idiomatic: Now I do not treat ranks lightly. How can officials arbitrarily take this!
translations.text: Now I do not treat ranks lightly. How can officials arbitrarily take this!

sentences.zh: 且法以有功勞行田宅，今小吏未嘗從軍者多滿，而有功者顧不得，背公立私，守尉長吏教訓甚不善。

translations.idiomatic: Moreover, the law is that fields and homes are given based on merit and service. Now minor officials who have never served in the army have many who are satisfied, while those with merit instead do not get them. This abandons the public for private, and the commandery and county officials' teaching is very improper.
translations.text: Moreover, the law is that fields and homes are given based on merit and service. Now minor officials who have never served in the army have many who are satisfied, while those with merit instead do not get them. This abandons the public for private, and the commandery and county officials' teaching is very improper.

sentences.zh: 其令諸吏善遇高爵，稱吾 意。

translations.idiomatic: Command all officials to treat high ranks well, according with my intention.
translations.text: Command all officials to treat high ranks well, according with my intention.

translations.idiomatic: The emperor held a banquet in Luoyang's southern palace.
translations.text: The emperor held a banquet in Luoyang's southern palace.

sentences.zh: 上曰：「通侯諸將毋敢隱朕，皆言其情。

translations.idiomatic: The emperor said: "Noble marquises and generals, do not dare conceal from me. All speak your true feelings.
translations.text: The emperor said: "Noble marquises and generals, do not dare conceal from me. All speak your true feelings.

sentences.zh: 吾所以有天下者何？

translations.idiomatic: Why did I obtain the world?
translations.text: Why did I obtain the world?

sentences.zh: 項氏之所以失天下者 何？」

translations.idiomatic: Why did the Xiang clan lose the world?"
translations.text: Why did the Xiang clan lose the world?"

sentences.zh: 高起、王陵對曰：「陛下嫚而侮人，項羽仁而敬人。

translations.idiomatic: Gao Qi and Wang Ling replied: "Your Majesty is casual and insults people. Xiang Yu is benevolent and respects people.
translations.text: Gao Qi and Wang Ling replied: "Your Majesty is casual and insults people. Xiang Yu is benevolent and respects people.

sentences.zh: 然陛下使人攻城略地，所降下者，因以與之，與天下同利也。

translations.idiomatic: However, when Your Majesty sends people to attack cities and seize territory, those who surrender are given it, sharing the world's benefits with them.
translations.text: However, when Your Majesty sends people to attack cities and seize territory, those who surrender are given it, sharing the world's benefits with them.

sentences.zh: 項羽妒賢嫉能，有功者害之，賢者疑之，戰 勝而不與人功，得地而不與人利，此其所以失天下也。」

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu was jealous of the worthy and envious of the able. He harmed those with merit, doubted the worthy. He won battles but did not give credit to others, obtained land but did not share benefits with others. This is why he lost the world."
translations.text: Xiang Yu was jealous of the worthy and envious of the able. He harmed those with merit, doubted the worthy. He won battles but did not give credit to others, obtained land but did not share benefits with others. This is why he lost the world."

sentences.zh: 上曰：「公知其一，未知其二。

translations.idiomatic: The emperor said: "You know one aspect, but not the other.
translations.text: The emperor said: "You know one aspect, but not the other.

sentences.zh: 夫運籌帷幄之中，決勝千里之外，吾不如子房；

translations.idiomatic: Planning strategy within the command tent, deciding victory a thousand miles away - I am not equal to Zifang.
translations.text: Planning strategy within the command tent, deciding victory a thousand miles away - I am not equal to Zifang.

sentences.zh: 填國家，撫百姓，給餉餽， 不絕糧道，吾不如蕭何；

translations.idiomatic: Filling the state treasury, comforting the people, providing supplies without interruption, maintaining the grain routes - I am not equal to Xiao He.
translations.text: Filling the state treasury, comforting the people, providing supplies without interruption, maintaining the grain routes - I am not equal to Xiao He.

sentences.zh: 連百萬之眾，戰必勝，攻必取，吾不如韓信。

translations.idiomatic: Commanding a million troops, fighting must win, attacking must take - I am not equal to Han Xin.
translations.text: Commanding a million troops, fighting must win, attacking must take - I am not equal to Han Xin.

sentences.zh: 三者皆人傑，吾能用之，此吾所以取天下者也。

translations.idiomatic: These three are all outstanding men. I can employ them. This is why I obtained the world.
translations.text: These three are all outstanding men. I can employ them. This is why I obtained the world.

sentences.zh: 項羽有一范增而不能用，此所以為我禽也。」

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu had one Fan Zeng but could not employ him. This is why he was captured by me."
translations.text: Xiang Yu had one Fan Zeng but could not employ him. This is why he was captured by me."

sentences.zh: 群臣說服。

translations.idiomatic: The ministers were all convinced.
translations.text: The ministers were all convinced.

sentences.zh: 初，田橫歸彭越。

translations.idiomatic: Initially, Tian Heng had gone to Peng Yue.
translations.text: Initially, Tian Heng had gone to Peng Yue.

sentences.zh: 項羽已滅，橫懼誅，與賓客亡入海。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu had already been destroyed. Heng feared execution and fled to the sea with his retainers.
translations.text: Xiang Yu had already been destroyed. Heng feared execution and fled to the sea with his retainers.

sentences.zh: 上恐其久為亂，遣使者赦橫，曰：「橫來，大者王，小者侯；

translations.idiomatic: The emperor feared he would long cause disorder, so he sent an envoy to pardon Heng, saying: "If Heng comes, the great one will be king, the small one will be marquis.
translations.text: The emperor feared he would long cause disorder, so he sent an envoy to pardon Heng, saying: "If Heng comes, the great one will be king, the small one will be marquis.

sentences.zh: 不來，且發兵加誅。」

translations.idiomatic: If he does not come, I will send troops to execute him."
translations.text: If he does not come, I will send troops to execute him."

sentences.zh: 橫懼，乘傳詣雒陽，未至三十里，自殺。

translations.idiomatic: Heng was afraid and rode the imperial relay to Luoyang. Thirty li from arriving, he committed suicide.
translations.text: Heng was afraid and rode the imperial relay to Luoyang. Thirty li from arriving, he committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 上壯其節，為流涕，發卒二千人，以王禮葬焉。

translations.idiomatic: The emperor admired his integrity and shed tears. He sent 2,000 troops and buried him with kingly rites.
translations.text: The emperor admired his integrity and shed tears. He sent 2,000 troops and buried him with kingly rites.

sentences.zh: 戍卒婁敬求見，說上曰：「陛下取天下與周異，而都雒陽，不便，不如入關，據秦之固。」

translations.idiomatic: Guard commander Lou Jing sought an audience and advised the emperor: "Your Majesty obtained the world differently from the Zhou, but establishing the capital at Luoyang is inconvenient. It would be better to enter the passes and occupy Qin's strongholds."
translations.text: Guard commander Lou Jing sought an audience and advised the emperor: "Your Majesty obtained the world differently from the Zhou, but establishing the capital at Luoyang is inconvenient. It would be better to enter the passes and occupy Qin's strongholds."

sentences.zh: 上以問張良，良因勸上。

translations.idiomatic: The emperor asked Zhang Liang, who then advised the emperor.
translations.text: The emperor asked Zhang Liang, who then advised the emperor.

sentences.zh: 是日，車駕西都長安。

translations.idiomatic: That day, the imperial chariot went west to establish the capital at Chang'an.
translations.text: That day, the imperial chariot went west to establish the capital at Chang'an.

sentences.zh: 拜婁敬為奉春君，賜姓劉氏。

translations.idiomatic: He appointed Lou Jing as Lord Fengchun and granted him the surname Liu.
translations.text: He appointed Lou Jing as Lord Fengchun and granted him the surname Liu.

sentences.zh: 六月壬辰，大赦天下。

translations.idiomatic: In the sixth month on the day renchen, there was a great amnesty for the world.
translations.text: In the sixth month on the day renchen, there was a great amnesty for the world.

sentences.zh: 秋七月，燕王臧荼反，上自將征之。

translations.idiomatic: In the seventh month of autumn, King Yan Zang Tu rebelled. The emperor personally led troops to campaign against him.
translations.text: In the seventh month of autumn, King Yan Zang Tu rebelled. The emperor personally led troops to campaign against him.

sentences.zh: 九月，虜荼。

translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month, he captured Tu.
translations.text: In the ninth month, he captured Tu.

sentences.zh: 詔諸侯王視有功者立以為燕王。

translations.idiomatic: He commanded the feudal lords to examine those with merit and establish one as King of Yan.
translations.text: He commanded the feudal lords to examine those with merit and establish one as King of Yan.

sentences.zh: 荊王臣信等十人皆曰：「太尉長安侯盧綰功最多，請立以為燕王。」

translations.idiomatic: King Jing Chen Xin and ten others all said: "Grand Marshal Lord Chang'an Lu Wan has the most merit. Please establish him as King of Yan."
translations.text: King Jing Chen Xin and ten others all said: "Grand Marshal Lord Chang'an Lu Wan has the most merit. Please establish him as King of Yan."

sentences.zh: 使丞相噲將兵平代地。

translations.idiomatic: He sent Chancellor Kuai to lead troops and pacify Dai territory.
translations.text: He sent Chancellor Kuai to lead troops and pacify Dai territory.

sentences.zh: 利幾反，上自擊破之。

translations.idiomatic: Li Ji rebelled. The emperor personally attacked and defeated him.
translations.text: Li Ji rebelled. The emperor personally attacked and defeated him.

sentences.zh: 利幾者，項羽將。

translations.idiomatic: Li Ji was Xiang Yu's general.
translations.text: Li Ji was Xiang Yu's general.

sentences.zh: 羽敗，利幾為陳令，降，上侯之潁川。

translations.idiomatic: Yu was defeated. Li Ji became magistrate of Chen and surrendered. The emperor enfeoffed him in Yingchuan.
translations.text: Yu was defeated. Li Ji became magistrate of Chen and surrendered. The emperor enfeoffed him in Yingchuan.

sentences.zh: 上至雒陽，舉通侯籍召之，而利幾恐，反。

translations.idiomatic: The emperor reached Luoyang and examined the noble marquises' registers to summon him, but Li Ji feared and rebelled.
translations.text: The emperor reached Luoyang and examined the noble marquises' registers to summon him, but Li Ji feared and rebelled.

sentences.zh: 後九月，徙諸侯子關中。

translations.idiomatic: Nine months later, he moved the feudal lords' sons to Guanzhong.
translations.text: Nine months later, he moved the feudal lords' sons to Guanzhong.

sentences.zh: 治長樂宮。

translations.idiomatic: He constructed the Changlegong Palace.
translations.text: He constructed the Changlegong Palace.

sentences.zh: 六年冬十月，令天下縣邑城。

translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month of winter in the sixth year, he commanded all counties and towns in the world to build walls.
translations.text: In the tenth month of winter in the sixth year, he commanded all counties and towns in the world to build walls.

sentences.zh: 人告楚王信謀反，上問左右，左右爭欲擊之。

translations.idiomatic: Someone informed that King Chu Han Xin was plotting rebellion. The emperor asked his attendants. The attendants all wished to attack him.
translations.text: Someone informed that King Chu Han Xin was plotting rebellion. The emperor asked his attendants. The attendants all wished to attack him.

sentences.zh: 用陳平計，乃偽游雲夢。

translations.idiomatic: Using Chen Ping's plan, he pretended to tour Yunmeng.
translations.text: Using Chen Ping's plan, he pretended to tour Yunmeng.

sentences.zh: 十二月，會諸侯于陳，楚王信迎謁，因執之。

translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month, he assembled the feudal lords at Chen. King Chu Xin came to greet him, and he arrested him.
translations.text: In the twelfth month, he assembled the feudal lords at Chen. King Chu Xin came to greet him, and he arrested him.

translations.text: The edict said: "

translations.idiomatic: The world is now pacified. The heroic and outstanding with merit have been enfeoffed as marquises. Newly established, I have not yet been able to fully reward their merit.
translations.text: The world is now pacified. The heroic and outstanding with merit have been enfeoffed as marquises. Newly established, I have not yet been able to fully reward their merit.

sentences.zh: 身居軍九年，或未習法令，或以其故犯法，大者死 刑，吾甚憐之。

translations.idiomatic: They have been in the army nine years. Some are not yet accustomed to the laws, or because of their past violate the law. The great ones receive death penalties. I pity them greatly.
translations.text: They have been in the army nine years. Some are not yet accustomed to the laws, or because of their past violate the law. The great ones receive death penalties. I pity them greatly.

sentences.zh: 田肯賀上曰：「甚善，陛下得韓信，又治秦中。

translations.idiomatic: Tian Ken congratulated the emperor: "Very good. Your Majesty has obtained Han Xin and also governs Qinzhong.
translations.text: Tian Ken congratulated the emperor: "Very good. Your Majesty has obtained Han Xin and also governs Qinzhong.

sentences.zh: 秦，形勝之國也，帶河阻山，縣隔千里，持戟百萬，秦得百二焉。

translations.idiomatic: Qin is a country of advantageous terrain. It girds the river and is blocked by mountains, spanning a thousand li, holding a million halberds. Qin obtained one hundred and twenty percent of them.
translations.text: Qin is a country of advantageous terrain. It girds the river and is blocked by mountains, spanning a thousand li, holding a million halberds. Qin obtained one hundred and twenty percent of them.

sentences.zh: 地勢便利，其以下兵 於諸侯，譬猶居高屋之上建瓴水也。

translations.idiomatic: The terrain is convenient. Sending troops from here against the feudal lords is like living on a high roof and pouring water from the eaves.
translations.text: The terrain is convenient. Sending troops from here against the feudal lords is like living on a high roof and pouring water from the eaves.

sentences.zh: 夫齊，東有琅邪、即墨之饒，南有泰山之固，西有濁河之限，北有勃海之利，地方二千里，持戟百萬，縣隔千里之外，齊得十二 焉。

translations.idiomatic: Qi to the east has the richness of Langya and Jimo, to the south has the strength of Mount Tai, to the west has the barrier of the Zhu River, to the north has the advantage of the Bohai Sea. translations.idiomatic: The emperor said: "Good."
translations.text: The emperor said: "Good."

translations.idiomatic: He granted five hundred jin of gold.
translations.text: He granted five hundred jin of gold.

sentences.zh: 上還至雒陽，赦韓信，封為淮陰侯。

translations.idiomatic: The emperor returned to Luoyang, pardoned Han Xin, and enfeoffed him as Marquis of Huaiyin.
translations.text: The emperor returned to Luoyang, pardoned Han Xin, and enfeoffed him as Marquis of Huaiyin.

sentences.zh: 甲申，始剖符封功臣曹參等為通侯。

translations.idiomatic: On the day jiashen, he first divided tallies and enfeoffed meritorious ministers Cao Shen and others as noble marquises.
translations.text: On the day jiashen, he first divided tallies and enfeoffed meritorious ministers Cao Shen and others as noble marquises.

sentences.zh: 詔曰：「齊，古之建國也，今為郡縣，其復以為諸侯。

translations.idiomatic: The edict said: "Qi is an ancient established state. Now it is commanderies and counties. Restore it as feudal lords.
translations.text: The edict said: "Qi is an ancient established state. Now it is commanderies and counties. Restore it as feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 將軍劉賈數有 大功，及擇寬惠脩絜者，王齊、荊地。」

translations.idiomatic: General Liu Jia has repeatedly had great merit. Choose one who is lenient, benevolent, and pure to be king of Qi and Jing territories."
translations.text: General Liu Jia has repeatedly had great merit. Choose one who is lenient, benevolent, and pure to be king of Qi and Jing territories."

sentences.zh: 春正月丙午，韓王信等奏請以故東陽郡、鄣郡、吳郡五十三縣立劉賈為荊王，以碭郡、薛郡、郯郡三十六縣立弟文信君交為 楚王。

translations.idiomatic: In the first month of spring on the day bingwu, King Han Xin and others petitioned to establish Liu Jia as King of Jing with the former Dongyang commandery, Zhang commandery, Wu commandery, fifty-three counties; and to establish younger brother Lord Wenxin Jiao as King of Chu with Dang commandery, Xue commandery, Tan commandery, thirty-six counties.
translations.text: In the first month of spring on the day bingwu, King Han Xin and others petitioned to establish Liu Jia as King of Jing with the former Dongyang commandery, Zhang commandery, Wu commandery, fifty-three counties; and to establish younger brother Lord Wenxin Jiao as King of Chu with Dang commandery, Xue commandery, Tan commandery, thirty-six counties.

sentences.zh: 壬子，以雲中、鴈門、代郡五十三縣立兄宜信侯喜為代王，以膠東、膠西、臨淄、濟北、博陽、城陽郡七十三縣立子肥為齊王，以太原郡三十一縣為韓國，徙 韓王信都晉陽。

translations.idiomatic: On the day renzi, he established elder brother Lord Yixin Xi as King of Dai with Yunzhong, Yanmen, Dai commanderies, fifty-three counties; established son Fei as King of Qi with Jiaodong, Jiaoxi, Linzi, Jibei, Boyang, Chengyang commanderies, seventy-three counties; made Taiyuan commandery thirty-one counties into Han kingdom, moved King Han Xin to establish capital at Jinyang.
translations.text: On the day renzi, he established elder brother Lord Yixin Xi as King of Dai with Yunzhong, Yanmen, Dai commanderies, fifty-three counties; established son Fei as King of Qi with Jiaodong, Jiaoxi, Linzi, Jibei, Boyang, Chengyang commanderies, seventy-three counties; made Taiyuan commandery thirty-one counties into Han kingdom, moved King Han Xin to establish capital at Jinyang.

sentences.zh: 上已封大功臣三十餘人，其餘爭功，未得行封。

translations.idiomatic: The emperor had already enfeoffed over thirty great meritorious ministers. The rest contended for merit and had not yet received enfeoffment.
translations.text: The emperor had already enfeoffed over thirty great meritorious ministers. The rest contended for merit and had not yet received enfeoffment.

sentences.zh: 上居南宮，從復道上見諸將往往耦語，以問張良。

translations.idiomatic: The emperor resided in the southern palace. From the covered walkway above he saw the generals often talking in pairs. He asked Zhang Liang about it.
translations.text: The emperor resided in the southern palace. From the covered walkway above he saw the generals often talking in pairs. He asked Zhang Liang about it.

sentences.zh: 良曰： 「陛下與此屬共取天下，今已為天子，而所封皆故人所愛，所誅皆平生仇怨。

translations.idiomatic: Liang said: "Your Majesty took the world together with these people. Now you are emperor, but those you enfeoff are all old friends you love, those you execute are all lifelong enemies.
translations.text: Liang said: "Your Majesty took the world together with these people. Now you are emperor, but those you enfeoff are all old friends you love, those you execute are all lifelong enemies.

sentences.zh: 今軍吏計功，以天下為不足用遍封，而恐以過失及誅，故相聚謀反耳。」

translations.idiomatic: Now the army officers calculate merit, considering the world insufficient to universally enfeoff, and fear that faults will lead to execution, so they gather to plot rebellion."
translations.text: Now the army officers calculate merit, considering the world insufficient to universally enfeoff, and fear that faults will lead to execution, so they gather to plot rebellion."

sentences.zh: 上曰：「為之 奈何？」

translations.idiomatic: The emperor said: "What should be done?"
translations.text: The emperor said: "What should be done?"

sentences.zh: 良曰：「取上素所不快，計群臣所共知最甚者一人，先封以示群臣。」

translations.idiomatic: Liang said: "Take one whom the emperor has always disliked, whom the ministers all know had the greatest faults, and enfeoff him first to show the ministers."
translations.text: Liang said: "Take one whom the emperor has always disliked, whom the ministers all know had the greatest faults, and enfeoff him first to show the ministers."

sentences.zh: 三月，上置酒，封雍齒，因趣丞相急定功行封。

translations.idiomatic: In the third month, the emperor held a banquet and enfeoffed Yong Chi. He then urged the chancellor to quickly determine merit and carry out enfeoffments.
translations.text: In the third month, the emperor held a banquet and enfeoffed Yong Chi. He then urged the chancellor to quickly determine merit and carry out enfeoffments.

sentences.zh: 罷酒，群臣皆喜，曰：「雍齒且侯， 吾屬亡患矣！」

translations.idiomatic: The banquet ended. All the ministers were happy, saying: "Even Yong Chi is made marquis. We have no worries!"
translations.text: The banquet ended. All the ministers were happy, saying: "Even Yong Chi is made marquis. We have no worries!"

sentences.zh: 上歸櫟陽，五日一朝太公。

translations.idiomatic: The emperor returned to Queyang. He visited the Duke of Tai every five days.
translations.text: The emperor returned to Queyang. He visited the Duke of Tai every five days.

sentences.zh: 太公家令說太公曰：「天亡二日，土亡二王。

translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Tai's household steward advised the Duke of Tai: "Heaven has no two suns, earth has no two kings.
translations.text: The Duke of Tai's household steward advised the Duke of Tai: "Heaven has no two suns, earth has no two kings.

sentences.zh: 皇帝雖子，人主也；

translations.idiomatic: The emperor is son, but is the ruler.
translations.text: The emperor is son, but is the ruler.

sentences.zh: 太公雖父， 人臣也。

translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Tai is father, but is a subject.
translations.text: The Duke of Tai is father, but is a subject.

sentences.zh: 奈何令人主拜人臣！

translations.idiomatic: How can you make the ruler bow to a subject!
translations.text: How can you make the ruler bow to a subject!

sentences.zh: 如此，則威重不行。」

translations.idiomatic: If you do this, then imperial authority will not be carried out."
translations.text: If you do this, then imperial authority will not be carried out."

sentences.zh: 後上朝，太公擁彗，迎門卻行。

translations.idiomatic: Later when the emperor came to court, the Duke of Tai held a broom and went backwards to meet him at the gate.
translations.text: Later when the emperor came to court, the Duke of Tai held a broom and went backwards to meet him at the gate.

sentences.zh: 上大驚，下扶太公。

translations.idiomatic: The emperor was greatly shocked and got down to support the Duke of Tai.
translations.text: The emperor was greatly shocked and got down to support the Duke of Tai.

sentences.zh: 太公曰：「帝，人主，奈何以我亂天下法！」

translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Tai said: "The emperor is the ruler of men. How can you disorder the world's laws for my sake!"
translations.text: The Duke of Tai said: "The emperor is the ruler of men. How can you disorder the world's laws for my sake!"

sentences.zh: 於是上心善家 令言，賜黃金五百斤。

translations.idiomatic: So the emperor in his heart approved of the household steward's words and granted five hundred jin of gold.
translations.text: So the emperor in his heart approved of the household steward's words and granted five hundred jin of gold.

translations.idiomatic: In the fifth month of summer on the day bingwu, the edict said: "Of human relations, none is closer than father and son. Therefore when father has the world it is transmitted to son, when son has the world honor returns to father. This is the extreme of human righteousness.
translations.text: In the fifth month of summer on the day bingwu, the edict said: "Of human relations, none is closer than father and son. Therefore when father has the world it is transmitted to son, when son has the world honor returns to father. This is the extreme of human righteousness.

sentences.zh: 前日天下大亂，兵革並起，萬民苦 殃，朕親被堅執銳，自帥士卒，犯危難，平暴亂，立諸侯，偃兵息民，天下大安，此皆太公之教訓也。

translations.idiomatic: Previously the world was in great disorder, weapons and armor rose together, the ten thousand people suffered calamity. I personally wore armor and grasped sharp weapons, personally led the officers and soldiers, faced danger and difficulty, pacified violent disorder, established the feudal lords, laid down arms and rested the people, the world is greatly peaceful. This is all due to the Duke of Tai's teaching and instruction.
translations.text: Previously the world was in great disorder, weapons and armor rose together, the ten thousand people suffered calamity. I personally wore armor and grasped sharp weapons, personally led the officers and soldiers, faced danger and difficulty, pacified violent disorder, established the feudal lords, laid down arms and rested the people, the world is greatly peaceful. This is all due to the Duke of Tai's teaching and instruction.

sentences.zh: 諸王、通侯、將軍、群卿、大夫已尊朕為皇帝，而太公未有 號。

translations.idiomatic: The various kings, noble marquises, generals, ministers, grand masters have honored me as emperor, but the Duke of Tai has no title.
translations.text: The various kings, noble marquises, generals, ministers, grand masters have honored me as emperor, but the Duke of Tai has no title.

sentences.zh: 今上尊太公曰太上皇。」

translations.idiomatic: Now I honor the Duke of Tai as Taishang Huang."
translations.text: Now I honor the Duke of Tai as Taishang Huang."

sentences.zh: 秋九月，匈奴圍韓王信於馬邑，信降匈奴。

translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month of autumn, the Xiongnu besieged King Han Xin at Mayi. Xin surrendered to the Xiongnu.
translations.text: In the ninth month of autumn, the Xiongnu besieged King Han Xin at Mayi. Xin surrendered to the Xiongnu.

sentences.zh: 七年冬十月，上自將擊韓王信於銅鞮，斬其將。

translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month of winter in the seventh year, the emperor personally led troops to attack King Han Xin at Tongdi, beheading his generals.
translations.text: In the tenth month of winter in the seventh year, the emperor personally led troops to attack King Han Xin at Tongdi, beheading his generals.

sentences.zh: 信亡走匈奴，與其將曼丘臣、王黃共立故趙後趙利為王，收信散兵，與匈奴共距漢。

translations.idiomatic: Xin fled to the Xiongnu, and together with his generals Manqiu Chen and Wang Huang established the former Zhao descendant Zhao Li as king. They gathered Xin's scattered troops and together with the Xiongnu resisted Han.
translations.text: Xin fled to the Xiongnu, and together with his generals Manqiu Chen and Wang Huang established the former Zhao descendant Zhao Li as king. They gathered Xin's scattered troops and together with the Xiongnu resisted Han.

sentences.zh: 上從晉陽連戰，乘勝逐北，至樓煩，會大寒，士卒墮指者什二三。

translations.idiomatic: The emperor from Jinyang fought continuous battles, riding victory to pursue the enemy, reaching Loufan. Encountering great cold, soldiers with frostbitten fingers were twelve or thirteen out of ten.
translations.text: The emperor from Jinyang fought continuous battles, riding victory to pursue the enemy, reaching Loufan. Encountering great cold, soldiers with frostbitten fingers were twelve or thirteen out of ten.

sentences.zh: 遂至平城，為匈奴所圍，七日，用陳平祕計得出。

translations.idiomatic: He arrived at Pingcheng and was surrounded by the Xiongnu for seven days. Using Chen Ping's secret plan, he got out.
translations.text: He arrived at Pingcheng and was surrounded by the Xiongnu for seven days. Using Chen Ping's secret plan, he got out.

sentences.zh: 使樊噲留定代地。

translations.idiomatic: He sent Fan Kuai to remain and pacify Dai territory.
translations.text: He sent Fan Kuai to remain and pacify Dai territory.

sentences.zh: 十二月，上還過趙，不禮趙王。

translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month, the emperor returned passing through Zhao and did not show courtesy to King Zhao.
translations.text: In the twelfth month, the emperor returned passing through Zhao and did not show courtesy to King Zhao.

sentences.zh: 是月，匈奴攻代，代王喜棄國，自歸雒陽，赦為合陽侯。

translations.idiomatic: This month, the Xiongnu attacked Dai. King Dai Xi abandoned the kingdom and personally returned to Luoyang. He was pardoned and made Marquis of Heyang.
translations.text: This month, the Xiongnu attacked Dai. King Dai Xi abandoned the kingdom and personally returned to Luoyang. He was pardoned and made Marquis of Heyang.

sentences.zh: 辛卯，立子如意為代王。

translations.idiomatic: On the day xinsi, he established son Ruyi as King of Dai.
translations.text: On the day xinsi, he established son Ruyi as King of Dai.

sentences.zh: 春，令郎中有罪耐以上，請之。

translations.idiomatic: In spring, he commanded that palace gentlemen with punishments of tattooing or above could redeem themselves.
translations.text: In spring, he commanded that palace gentlemen with punishments of tattooing or above could redeem themselves.

sentences.zh: 民產子，復勿事二歲。

translations.idiomatic: People who gave birth to children were exempted from service for two years.
translations.text: People who gave birth to children were exempted from service for two years.

sentences.zh: 二月，至長安。

translations.idiomatic: In the second month, he arrived at Chang'an.
translations.text: In the second month, he arrived at Chang'an.

sentences.zh: 蕭何治未央宮，立東闕、北闕、前殿、武庫、大倉。

translations.idiomatic: Xiao He had constructed the Weiyang Palace, establishing the eastern gate, northern gate, front hall, armory, and great granary.
translations.text: Xiao He had constructed the Weiyang Palace, establishing the eastern gate, northern gate, front hall, armory, and great granary.

sentences.zh: 上見其壯麗，甚怒，謂何曰：「天下 匈匈，勞苦數歲，成敗未可知，是何治宮室過度也！」

translations.idiomatic: The emperor saw its grandeur and was greatly angry. He said to He: "The world is in turmoil, we have labored bitterly for several years, success or failure is not yet known. Why have you constructed palace rooms excessively!"
translations.text: The emperor saw its grandeur and was greatly angry. He said to He: "The world is in turmoil, we have labored bitterly for several years, success or failure is not yet known. Why have you constructed palace rooms excessively!"

sentences.zh: 何曰：「天下方未定，故可因以就宮室。

translations.idiomatic: He said: "The world is not yet settled, so it is suitable to take advantage of this to complete the palace rooms.
translations.text: He said: "The world is not yet settled, so it is suitable to take advantage of this to complete the palace rooms.

sentences.zh: 且夫天子以四海為家，非令壯麗亡以重威，且亡令後世有以加也。」

translations.idiomatic: Moreover, the Son of Heaven takes the four seas as home. If not grand, there is no way to increase authority. And if not grand, future generations will have nothing to add."
translations.text: Moreover, the Son of Heaven takes the four seas as home. If not grand, there is no way to increase authority. And if not grand, future generations will have nothing to add."

sentences.zh: 上說。

translations.idiomatic: The emperor was pleased.
translations.text: The emperor was pleased.

sentences.zh: 自櫟陽徙都長安。

translations.idiomatic: He moved the capital from Queyang to Chang'an.
translations.text: He moved the capital from Queyang to Chang'an.

sentences.zh: 置宗正宮以序九族。

translations.idiomatic: He established the Palace of Imperial Clan Affairs to order the nine clans.
translations.text: He established the Palace of Imperial Clan Affairs to order the nine clans.

sentences.zh: 夏四月，行如雒陽。

translations.idiomatic: In the fourth month of summer, he traveled to Luoyang.
translations.text: In the fourth month of summer, he traveled to Luoyang.

sentences.zh: 八年冬，上東擊韓信餘寇於東垣。

translations.idiomatic: In the winter of the eighth year, the emperor went east to attack the remaining bandits of Han Xin at Dongyuan.
translations.text: In the winter of the eighth year, the emperor went east to attack the remaining bandits of Han Xin at Dongyuan.

sentences.zh: 還過趙，趙相貫高等恥上不禮其王，陰謀欲弒上。

translations.idiomatic: On the return passing through Zhao, Zhao chancellor Guan Gao and others were ashamed that the emperor did not show courtesy to their king, and secretly plotted to assassinate the emperor.
translations.text: On the return passing through Zhao, Zhao chancellor Guan Gao and others were ashamed that the emperor did not show courtesy to their king, and secretly plotted to assassinate the emperor.

sentences.zh: 上欲宿，心動，問「縣名何？」

translations.idiomatic: The emperor wanted to stay overnight. His heart was moved. He asked "What is the county name?"
translations.text: The emperor wanted to stay overnight. His heart was moved. He asked "What is the county name?"

sentences.zh: 曰：「柏人。」

translations.idiomatic: They said: "Boren."
translations.text: They said: "Boren."

sentences.zh: 上曰：「柏人者，迫於人也。」

translations.idiomatic: The emperor said: "Boren means 'pressed by people.'"
translations.text: The emperor said: "Boren means 'pressed by people.'"

sentences.zh: 去弗宿。

translations.idiomatic: He left and did not stay.
translations.text: He left and did not stay.

sentences.zh: 十一月，令士卒從軍死者為槥，歸其縣，縣給衣衾棺葬具，祠以少牢，長吏視葬。

translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh month, he commanded that soldiers who died in military service should be given coffins, returned to their counties, the counties providing burial clothes, shrouds, coffins, and funeral implements. They should be sacrificed to with a lesser sheep offering, and the chief officials should oversee the burial.
translations.text: In the eleventh month, he commanded that soldiers who died in military service should be given coffins, returned to their counties, the counties providing burial clothes, shrouds, coffins, and funeral implements. They should be sacrificed to with a lesser sheep offering, and the chief officials should oversee the burial.

sentences.zh: 十二月，行自東垣至。

translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month, he traveled from Dongyuan to arrive.
translations.text: In the twelfth month, he traveled from Dongyuan to arrive.

sentences.zh: 春三月，行如雒陽。

translations.idiomatic: In the third month of spring, he traveled to Luoyang.
translations.text: In the third month of spring, he traveled to Luoyang.

sentences.zh: 令吏卒從軍至平城及守城邑者皆復終身勿事。

translations.idiomatic: He commanded that officials and soldiers who followed the army to Pingcheng and guarded the walled cities should all be exempted from service for life.
translations.text: He commanded that officials and soldiers who followed the army to Pingcheng and guarded the walled cities should all be exempted from service for life.

sentences.zh: 爵非公乘以上毋得冠劉氏冠。

translations.idiomatic: Ranks below public chariot driver should not wear Liu clan caps.
translations.text: Ranks below public chariot driver should not wear Liu clan caps.

sentences.zh: 賈人毋得衣錦繡綺縠絺紵钛，操兵，乘騎馬。

translations.idiomatic: Merchants should not wear brocade, embroidered silk, fine gauze, or thin silk, handle weapons, or ride horses.
translations.text: Merchants should not wear brocade, embroidered silk, fine gauze, or thin silk, handle weapons, or ride horses.

sentences.zh: 秋八月，吏有罪未發覺者，赦之。

translations.idiomatic: In the eighth month of autumn, officials with crimes not yet discovered were pardoned.
translations.text: In the eighth month of autumn, officials with crimes not yet discovered were pardoned.

sentences.zh: 九月，行自雒陽至，淮南王、梁王、趙王、楚王皆從。

translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month, he traveled from Luoyang to arrive. The King of Huainan, King of Liang, King of Zhao, King of Chu all followed.
translations.text: In the ninth month, he traveled from Luoyang to arrive. The King of Huainan, King of Liang, King of Zhao, King of Chu all followed.

sentences.zh: 九年冬十月，淮南王、梁王、趙王、楚王朝未央宮，置酒前殿。

translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month of winter in the ninth year, the King of Huainan, King of Liang, King of Zhao, King of Chu paid court at the Weiyang Palace. A banquet was held in the front hall.
translations.text: In the tenth month of winter in the ninth year, the King of Huainan, King of Liang, King of Zhao, King of Chu paid court at the Weiyang Palace. A banquet was held in the front hall.

sentences.zh: 上奉玉卮為太上皇壽，曰：「始大人常以臣亡賴，不能治產業，不如仲力。

translations.idiomatic: The emperor held a jade goblet to toast the Taishang Huang, saying: "At first, father often said that I was worthless and could not manage property, unlike brother Zhong in strength.
translations.text: The emperor held a jade goblet to toast the Taishang Huang, saying: "At first, father often said that I was worthless and could not manage property, unlike brother Zhong in strength.

sentences.zh: 今某之業所就孰與仲多？」

translations.idiomatic: Now whose achievement that I have accomplished is greater, mine or brother Zhong's?"
translations.text: Now whose achievement that I have accomplished is greater, mine or brother Zhong's?"

sentences.zh: 殿上群臣皆稱萬歲，大笑為樂。

translations.idiomatic: The ministers in the hall all shouted ten thousand years and laughed with great joy.
translations.text: The ministers in the hall all shouted ten thousand years and laughed with great joy.

sentences.zh: 十一月，徙齊楚大族昭氏、屈氏、景氏、懷氏、田氏五姓關中，與利田宅。

translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh month, he moved the great clans of Qi and Chu - the Zhao, Qu, Jing, Huai, and Tian surnames - to Guanzhong, and gave them beneficial fields and homes.
translations.text: In the eleventh month, he moved the great clans of Qi and Chu - the Zhao, Qu, Jing, Huai, and Tian surnames - to Guanzhong, and gave them beneficial fields and homes.

sentences.zh: 十二月，行如雒陽。

translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month, he traveled to Luoyang.
translations.text: In the twelfth month, he traveled to Luoyang.

sentences.zh: 貫高等謀逆發覺，逮捕高等，并捕趙王敖下獄。

translations.idiomatic: Guan Gao and others' plot of rebellion was discovered. He arrested Gao and others, and also captured King Zhao Ao and threw him in prison.
translations.text: Guan Gao and others' plot of rebellion was discovered. He arrested Gao and others, and also captured King Zhao Ao and threw him in prison.

sentences.zh: 詔敢有隨王，罪三族。

translations.idiomatic: The edict commanded that anyone who followed the king would have their three clans executed.
translations.text: The edict commanded that anyone who followed the king would have their three clans executed.

sentences.zh: 郎中田叔、孟舒等十人自髡鉗為王家奴，從王就獄。

translations.idiomatic: Palace gentlemen Tian Shu, Meng Shu and ten others shaved their heads and wore cangues to become the king's household slaves, following the king to prison.
translations.text: Palace gentlemen Tian Shu, Meng Shu and ten others shaved their heads and wore cangues to become the king's household slaves, following the king to prison.

sentences.zh: 王實不知其謀。

translations.idiomatic: The king truly did not know of their plot.
translations.text: The king truly did not know of their plot.

sentences.zh: 春正月，廢趙王敖為宣平侯。

translations.idiomatic: In the first month of spring, he deposed King Zhao Ao as Marquis of Xuanping.
translations.text: In the first month of spring, he deposed King Zhao Ao as Marquis of Xuanping.

sentences.zh: 徙代王如意為趙王，王趙國。

translations.idiomatic: He moved King Dai Ruyi to become King of Zhao, ruling the Zhao kingdom.
translations.text: He moved King Dai Ruyi to become King of Zhao, ruling the Zhao kingdom.

sentences.zh: 丙寅，前有罪殊死以下，皆赦之。

translations.idiomatic: On the day bingyin, all those previously sentenced to death or below were pardoned.
translations.text: On the day bingyin, all those previously sentenced to death or below were pardoned.

sentences.zh: 二月，行自雒陽至。

translations.idiomatic: In the second month, he traveled from Luoyang to arrive.
translations.text: In the second month, he traveled from Luoyang to arrive.

sentences.zh: 賢趙臣田叔、孟舒等十人，召見與語，漢廷臣無能出其右者。

translations.idiomatic: He considered the worthy Zhao ministers Tian Shu, Meng Shu and ten others excellent. He summoned them for audience and spoke with them. Among the Han court ministers, none could surpass them.
translations.text: He considered the worthy Zhao ministers Tian Shu, Meng Shu and ten others excellent. He summoned them for audience and spoke with them. Among the Han court ministers, none could surpass them.

sentences.zh: 上說，盡拜為郡守、諸侯相。

translations.idiomatic: The emperor was pleased and appointed them all as commandery governors and feudal lord prime ministers.
translations.text: The emperor was pleased and appointed them all as commandery governors and feudal lord prime ministers.

sentences.zh: 夏六月乙未晦，日有食之。

translations.idiomatic: In the sixth month of summer on the last day of the month, the sun was eclipsed.
translations.text: In the sixth month of summer on the last day of the month, the sun was eclipsed.

sentences.zh: 十年冬十月，淮南王、燕王、荊王、梁王、楚王、齊王、長沙王來朝。

translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month of winter in the tenth year, the King of Huainan, King of Yan, King of Jing, King of Liang, King of Chu, King of Qi, King of Changsha all came to court.
translations.text: In the tenth month of winter in the tenth year, the King of Huainan, King of Yan, King of Jing, King of Liang, King of Chu, King of Qi, King of Changsha all came to court.

sentences.zh: 夏五月，太上皇后崩。

translations.idiomatic: In the fifth month of summer, the Taishang Empress passed away.
translations.text: In the fifth month of summer, the Taishang Empress passed away.

sentences.zh: 秋七月癸卯，太上皇崩，葬萬年。

translations.idiomatic: In the seventh month of autumn on the day guimao, the Taishang Huang passed away and was buried at Wannian.
translations.text: In the seventh month of autumn on the day guimao, the Taishang Huang passed away and was buried at Wannian.

sentences.zh: 赦櫟陽囚死罪以下。

translations.idiomatic: He pardoned death sentences and below for prisoners in Queyang.
translations.text: He pardoned death sentences and below for prisoners in Queyang.

sentences.zh: 八月，令諸侯王皆立太上皇廟于國都。

translations.idiomatic: In the eighth month, he commanded all feudal lords to establish Taishang Huang temples in their capitals.
translations.text: In the eighth month, he commanded all feudal lords to establish Taishang Huang temples in their capitals.

sentences.zh: 九月，代相國陳豨反。

translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month, Dai prime minister Chen Xi rebelled.
translations.text: In the ninth month, Dai prime minister Chen Xi rebelled.

sentences.zh: 上曰：「豨嘗為吾使，甚有信。

translations.idiomatic: The emperor said: "Xi once served as my envoy and was very trustworthy.
translations.text: The emperor said: "Xi once served as my envoy and was very trustworthy.

sentences.zh: 代地吾所急，故封豨為列侯，以相國守代，今乃與 王黃等劫掠代地！

translations.idiomatic: Dai territory is what I consider urgent, so I enfeoffed Xi as a marquis to guard Dai as prime minister. Now he joins with Wang Huang and others to plunder Dai territory!
translations.text: Dai territory is what I consider urgent, so I enfeoffed Xi as a marquis to guard Dai as prime minister. Now he joins with Wang Huang and others to plunder Dai territory!

sentences.zh: 吏民非有罪也，能去豨、黃來歸者，皆赦之。」

translations.idiomatic: Officials and people have no crime. Those who can leave Xi and Huang and return will all be pardoned."
translations.text: Officials and people have no crime. Those who can leave Xi and Huang and return will all be pardoned."

sentences.zh: 上自東，至邯鄲。

translations.idiomatic: The emperor went east himself and arrived at Handan.
translations.text: The emperor went east himself and arrived at Handan.

sentences.zh: 上喜曰：「豨不南據邯鄲而阻漳水，吾知其亡能為矣。」

translations.idiomatic: The emperor was pleased and said: "Xi does not occupy Handan to the south and block the Zhang River. I know he has no ability."
translations.text: The emperor was pleased and said: "Xi does not occupy Handan to the south and block the Zhang River. I know he has no ability."

sentences.zh: 趙相周昌奏常山二十五 城亡其二十城，請誅守尉。

translations.idiomatic: Zhao prime minister Zhou Chang memorialized that of Changshan's twenty-five cities, twenty cities were lost, requesting execution of the guards and commandants.
translations.text: Zhao prime minister Zhou Chang memorialized that of Changshan's twenty-five cities, twenty cities were lost, requesting execution of the guards and commandants.

sentences.zh: 上曰：「守尉反乎？」

translations.idiomatic: The emperor said: "Did the guards and commandants rebel?"
translations.text: The emperor said: "Did the guards and commandants rebel?"

sentences.zh: 對曰：「不。」

translations.idiomatic: He replied: "No."
translations.text: He replied: "No."

sentences.zh: 上曰：「是力不足，亡罪。」

translations.idiomatic: The emperor said: "Then their strength was insufficient. No crime."
translations.text: The emperor said: "Then their strength was insufficient. No crime."

sentences.zh: 上令周昌選趙壯士可令將者，白見四人。

translations.idiomatic: The emperor commanded Zhou Chang to select Zhao warriors who could be made generals. He presented four men.
translations.text: The emperor commanded Zhou Chang to select Zhao warriors who could be made generals. He presented four men.

sentences.zh: 上嫚罵曰：「豎子能為將 乎！」

translations.idiomatic: The emperor insulted them saying: "You bastards can be generals?"
translations.text: The emperor insulted them saying: "You bastards can be generals?"

sentences.zh: 四人慚，皆伏地。

translations.idiomatic: The four were ashamed and all prostrated themselves.
translations.text: The four were ashamed and all prostrated themselves.

sentences.zh: 上封各千戶，以為將。

translations.idiomatic: The emperor enfeoffed each with a thousand households and made them generals.
translations.text: The emperor enfeoffed each with a thousand households and made them generals.

sentences.zh: 左右諫曰：「從入蜀漢，伐楚，賞未遍行，今封此，何功？」

translations.idiomatic: His attendants advised: "From entering Shu and Han, attacking Chu, rewards have not been universally distributed. Now enfeoffing these, what merit do they have?"
translations.text: His attendants advised: "From entering Shu and Han, attacking Chu, rewards have not been universally distributed. Now enfeoffing these, what merit do they have?"

sentences.zh: 上曰：「非汝所知。

translations.idiomatic: The emperor said: "This is not what you know.
translations.text: The emperor said: "This is not what you know.

sentences.zh: 陳豨反，趙代地皆豨有。

translations.idiomatic: Chen Xi has rebelled. Zhao and Dai territories are all Xi's.
translations.text: Chen Xi has rebelled. Zhao and Dai territories are all Xi's.

sentences.zh: 吾以羽檄 徵天下兵，未有至者，今計唯獨邯鄲中兵耳。

translations.idiomatic: I have summoned troops from the world with urgent dispatches, but none have arrived yet. Now my only hope is the troops in Handan.
translations.text: I have summoned troops from the world with urgent dispatches, but none have arrived yet. Now my only hope is the troops in Handan.

sentences.zh: 吾何愛四千戶，不以慰趙子弟！」

translations.idiomatic: Why should I begrudge four thousand households? I will not use them to console the Zhao youths!"
translations.text: Why should I begrudge four thousand households? I will not use them to console the Zhao youths!"

sentences.zh: 皆曰：「善。」

translations.idiomatic: They all said: "Good."
translations.text: They all said: "Good."

sentences.zh: 又求「樂毅有後乎？」

translations.idiomatic: He also asked: "Does Yue Yi have descendants?"
translations.text: He also asked: "Does Yue Yi have descendants?"

sentences.zh: 得其孫叔，封之樂鄉，號華成君。

translations.idiomatic: He obtained his grandson Shu and enfeoffed him at Yuexiang, titled Lord Huacheng.
translations.text: He obtained his grandson Shu and enfeoffed him at Yuexiang, titled Lord Huacheng.

sentences.zh: 問豨將，皆 故賈人。

translations.idiomatic: He questioned Xi's generals. They were all former merchants.
translations.text: He questioned Xi's generals. They were all former merchants.

sentences.zh: 上曰：「吾知與之矣。」

translations.idiomatic: The emperor said: "I know how to deal with them."
translations.text: The emperor said: "I know how to deal with them."

sentences.zh: 乃多以金購豨將，豨將多降。

translations.idiomatic: So he used much gold to buy Xi's generals. Xi's generals mostly surrendered.

translations.text: In the eleventh year winter, the emperor was at Handan.

translations.text: Xi's general Hou Chang led over ten thousand men to roam, Wang Huang led over a thousand cavalry to camp at Qu Ni, Zhang Chun led over ten thousand troops to cross the river and attack Liaocheng.

translations.text: Han general Guo Meng together with Qi generals attacked and greatly defeated them.

translations.text: Grand marshal Zhou Bo took the Taiyuan route to pacify Dai territory, reaching Mayi. Mayi did not submit, so he attacked and devastated it.

translations.idiomatic: Xi's general Zhao Li defended Dongyuan. Gaozu attacked but could not take it.
translations.text: Xi's general Zhao Li defended Dongyuan. Gaozu attacked but could not take it.

sentences.zh: 卒罵，上怒。

translations.idiomatic: The soldiers cursed. The emperor was angry.

sentences.zh: 城降，卒罵者斬之。

translations.idiomatic: The city surrendered. The cursing soldiers were executed.
translations.text: The city surrendered. The cursing soldiers were executed.

sentences.zh: 諸縣堅守不 降反寇者，復租賦三歲。

translations.idiomatic: The various counties that firmly defended and did not surrender to the rebel bandits had their taxes and levies exempted for three years.
translations.text: The various counties that firmly defended and did not surrender to the rebel bandits had their taxes and levies exempted for three years.

translations.idiomatic: In the first month of spring, Marquis of Huaiyin Han Xin plotted rebellion at Chang'an and his three clans were exterminated.
translations.text: In the first month of spring, Marquis of Huaiyin Han Xin plotted rebellion at Chang'an and his three clans were exterminated.

sentences.zh: 將軍柴武斬韓王信於參合。

translations.idiomatic: General Chai Wu beheaded King Han Xin at Canhe.
translations.text: General Chai Wu beheaded King Han Xin at Canhe.

sentences.zh: 上還雒陽。

translations.idiomatic: The emperor returned to Luoyang.
translations.text: The emperor returned to Luoyang.

translations.idiomatic: Take much of the Taiyuan territory south of the mountains and add it to Dai. Make Dai's Yunzhong and west into Yunzhong commandery, then Dai will receive fewer border bandits.
translations.text: Take much of the Taiyuan territory south of the mountains and add it to Dai. Make Dai's Yunzhong and west into Yunzhong commandery, then Dai will receive fewer border bandits.

translations.idiomatic: King Yan Wan, prime minister He and thirty-three others all said: "The son Heng is worthy, wise, gentle, and kind. Please establish him as King of Dai, capital at Jinyang."
translations.text: King Yan Wan, prime minister He and thirty-three others all said: "The son Heng is worthy, wise, gentle, and kind. Please establish him as King of Dai, capital at Jinyang."

sentences.zh: 大赦天下。

translations.idiomatic: There was a great amnesty for the world.
translations.text: There was a great amnesty for the world.

sentences.zh: 二月，詔曰：「欲省賦甚。

translations.idiomatic: In the second month, the edict said: "I desire to reduce levies greatly.
translations.text: In the second month, the edict said: "I desire to reduce levies greatly.

sentences.zh: 今獻未有程，吏或多賦以為獻，而諸侯王尤多，民疾之。

translations.idiomatic: Now tribute has no standard. Officials sometimes levy much to make tribute, and the feudal lords and kings especially much. The people suffer from it.
translations.text: Now tribute has no standard. Officials sometimes levy much to make tribute, and the feudal lords and kings especially much. The people suffer from it.

translations.idiomatic: He also said: "I have heard that among kings none was higher than Zhou Wen, among hegemons none was higher than Qi Huan. All relied on worthy men to achieve fame.
translations.text: He also said: "I have heard that among kings none was higher than Zhou Wen, among hegemons none was higher than Qi Huan. All relied on worthy men to achieve fame.

sentences.zh: 今天下賢者智能豈特古之人乎？

translations.idiomatic: Now in the world, are worthy men and the wise inferior to ancient people?
translations.text: Now in the world, are worthy men and the wise inferior to ancient people?

sentences.zh: 患 在人主不交故也，士奚由進！

translations.idiomatic: The trouble is that rulers do not associate with them. How can scholars advance!
translations.text: The trouble is that rulers do not associate with them. How can scholars advance!

sentences.zh: 今吾以天之靈，賢士大夫定有天下，以為一家，欲其長久，世世奉宗廟亡絕也。

translations.idiomatic: Now I, by Heaven's blessing, together with worthy scholars and grand masters have pacified the world and made it one family. I desire it to last long, generation after generation serving the ancestral temples without end.
translations.text: Now I, by Heaven's blessing, together with worthy scholars and grand masters have pacified the world and made it one family. I desire it to last long, generation after generation serving the ancestral temples without end.

sentences.zh: 賢人已與我共平之矣，而不與吾共安利之，可乎？

translations.idiomatic: Worthy men have already helped me pacify it, but do not help me secure and benefit it. Is this acceptable?
translations.text: Worthy men have already helped me pacify it, but do not help me secure and benefit it. Is this acceptable?

sentences.zh: 賢士 大夫有肯從我游者，吾能尊顯之。

translations.idiomatic: Worthy scholars and grand masters who are willing to follow me, I can honor and make them eminent.
translations.text: Worthy scholars and grand masters who are willing to follow me, I can honor and make them eminent.

sentences.zh: 布告天下，使明知朕意。

translations.idiomatic: Proclaim to the world, so they clearly know my intention.
translations.text: Proclaim to the world, so they clearly know my intention.

translations.text: If they have them but do not report, when discovered, they are dismissed.

translations.text: If old and ill, do not send."

translations.idiomatic: In the third month, King Liang Peng Yue plotted rebellion and his three clans were exterminated.
translations.text: In the third month, King Liang Peng Yue plotted rebellion and his three clans were exterminated.

sentences.zh: 詔曰：「擇可以為梁王、淮陽王者。」

translations.idiomatic: The edict said: "Select who can be King of Liang, King of Huaiyang."
translations.text: The edict said: "Select who can be King of Liang, King of Huaiyang."

sentences.zh: 燕王綰、相國何等請立子恢為梁王，子友為淮陽王。

translations.idiomatic: King Yan Wan, prime minister He and others requested establishing son Hui as King of Liang, son You as King of Huaiyang.
translations.text: King Yan Wan, prime minister He and others requested establishing son Hui as King of Liang, son You as King of Huaiyang.

sentences.zh: 罷東郡，頗益梁；

translations.idiomatic: Abolished Dong commandery, added much to Liang.
translations.text: Abolished Dong commandery, added much to Liang.

sentences.zh: 罷潁川郡，頗益淮陽。

translations.idiomatic: Abolished Yingchuan commandery, added much to Huaiyang.
translations.text: Abolished Yingchuan commandery, added much to Huaiyang.

sentences.zh: 夏四月，行自雒陽至。

translations.idiomatic: In the fourth month of summer, he traveled from Luoyang to arrive.
translations.text: In the fourth month of summer, he traveled from Luoyang to arrive.

sentences.zh: 令豐人徙關中者皆復終身。

translations.idiomatic: He commanded that Feng people who moved to Guanzhong all be exempted from service for life.
translations.text: He commanded that Feng people who moved to Guanzhong all be exempted from service for life.

translations.idiomatic: In the fifth month, the edict said: "Yue people's customs are fond of attacking each other. Previously Qin moved central counties' people to the southern three commanderies to mix with the Baiyue.
translations.text: In the fifth month, the edict said: "Yue people's customs are fond of attacking each other. Previously Qin moved central counties' people to the southern three commanderies to mix with the Baiyue.

translations.text: Now establish Zhao Tuo as King of Nanyue."
